  • Method Details

    • getDistance

      public static int getDistance​(int[] a, int[] b, int xDim, int yDim, boolean wrapped)
      Parameters:
      a - The 2 length int array representing the start coordinate (e.g. [x1,y1])
      b - The 2 length int array representing the end coordinate (e.g. [x2,y2])
      xDim - The x dimension of the grid
      yDim - The y dimension of the grid
      wrapped - Whether to allow distance through the edges of the grid
      Returns:
      The Manhattan distance between coordinates a and b

    • getDistance

      public static float getDistance​(Node nA, Node nB, int xDim, int yDim, boolean wrapped)
      Parameters:
      nA - The node representing the start coordinate
      nB - The node representing the end coordinate
      xDim - The x dimension of the grid
      yDim - The y dimension of the grid
      wrapped - Whether to allow distance through the edges of the grid
      Returns:
      The Manhattan distance between nodes nA and nB

    • getDistance

    • getDistance

      public static float getDistance​(int[] a, int[] b)
      Parameters:
      a - The 2 length int array representing the start coordinate (e.g. [x1,y1])
      b - The 2 length int array representing the end coordinate (e.g. [x2,y2])
      Returns:
      The Manhattan distance between coordinates a and b

    • subtract2DIntArray

      public static int[] subtract2DIntArray​(int[] a, int[] b)
      Parameters:
      a - The 2 length int array representing coordinate a (e.g. [x1,y1])
      b - The 2 length int array representing coordinate b (e.g. [x2,y2])
      Returns:
      [x1 - x2, x2 - y2]

    • dotProduct2DArray

      public static int[] dotProduct2DArray​(int[] a, int[] b)
      If lengths of a and b are not 2, null is returned
      Parameters:
      a - 2d vector a
      b - 2d vector b
      Returns:
      Dot product a.b
